meanings.definition: A person or thing that introduces or inserts something into a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The intromitter of the new exhibit carefully placed the artwork in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the intromitter of knowledge in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The curious intromitter of gossip always had the latest news to share.
meanings.sent4: She was the intromitter of joy, spreading happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The intromitter of change brought a fresh perspective to the team.

meanings.definition: To introduce or insert something into a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: He decided to intromit the key into the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The chef will intromit the secret ingredient into the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The magician intromitted the rabbit into the hat with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: She intromitted her ideas into the discussion, sparking a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The explorer intromitted the rare artifact into the museum's collection.
